How to Install duck on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • duck

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install duck on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing duck on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall duck in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install duck, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install duck Using apt

To install duck in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install duck using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install duck

The installation of duck might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install duck Using apt-get

To install duck using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install duck.

sudo apt-get -y install duck

Install duck Using Synaptic

To install duck using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install duck on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for duck. This will display the duck package in the package window, now to install duck, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the duck package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of duck.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install duck Using aptitude

To install duck on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of duck.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install duck using the command aptitude install duck.

sudo aptitude -y install duck

How to Upgrade duck on debian

If you want to upgrade the duck package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade duck using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade duck to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade duck.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade duck sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade duck

Upgrade duck using Aptitude

To upgrade duck using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade duck.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade duck

Upgrade duck using Synaptic

To upgrade duck using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for duck, now right-click duck, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade duck just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall duck on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall duck from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just duck, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove duck

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of duck

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of duck you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge duck

Remove duck using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall duck using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for duck, right-click the duck package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall duck click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install duck on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade duck using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of duck then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
